meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to 1/8 of an inch.
meanings.sent1: I need an oubit of fabric to finish my project.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter measured the wood using an oubit.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse squeezed through the hole that was just an oubit wide.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so precise, she could distinguish an oubit difference in length.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler carefully cut the gemstone into oubit-sized pieces.

meanings.sent1: I will oubit of the room when the movie ends.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to oubit of the house in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The magician will oubit from the box in a surprising trick.
meanings.sent4: The students will oubit of the classroom after the bell rings.
meanings.sent5: The bird will oubit of its nest to find food for its chicks.

meanings.definition: A small, enclosed space or compartment.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel found a cozy oubit in the tree hollow.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry box had a special oubit for each ring.
meanings.sent3: The tiny car barely fit in the parking oubit.
meanings.sent4: The secret compartment in the desk was a perfect oubit for hiding valuables.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut floated in the spacecraft's oubit around the Earth.
